title: Introduction to HTML
description: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the markup language used to structure content on web pages.

sections.heading: What is HTML?
sections.content: HTML is a markup language used to describe the structure of a web page. It consists of tags that define elements such as headings, paragraphs, images, and links.

sections.heading: Basic structure of an HTML document
sections.content: An HTML document starts with a <!DOCTYPE html> declaration, followed by the <html> tag which contains two main parts: <head> and <body>.

elementExplanation.title: Understanding an HTML Element
elementExplanation.intro: An HTML element consists of an opening tag, content, and a closing tag.

content.title: Content
content.desc: Hello World! — the visible text on the page

vscodeSetup.title: Install VS Code and Run HTML Locally
vscodeSetup.intro: Besides learning online, you can try writing HTML directly on your computer using Visual Studio Code.
vscodeSetup.step1: Go to https://code.visualstudio.com/ to download Visual Studio Code (VS Code) for free.
vscodeSetup.step2: Install VS Code as usual (click Next → Install).
vscodeSetup.step3: Open VS Code, choose File → New File and save it as index.html.
vscodeSetup.step4: Type the example HTML code shown above into your file.
vscodeSetup.step5: Right-click on the file → select Open with Live Server or open it directly in your browser to see the result.
vscodeSetup.tip: You can install the 'Live Server' extension in VS Code to view your HTML changes live.

attributes.title: HTML Attributes
attributes.intro: Attributes provide additional information about HTML elements. They are always specified in the start tag and usually come in name/value pairs like name="value".
attributes.href: Specifies the destination URL for a link.
attributes.src: Specifies the path to an image file or media source.
attributes.alt: Provides alternative text if the image cannot be displayed.
attributes.type: Defines the input type or button behavior.
attributes.style: Allows you to apply inline CSS styles directly to an element.
